column1: This MS&L Railway Company site seems likely to have been part of its Sheffield and South Yorkshire Navigation system of canals and waterways, which came under MS&LR control in 1864.
MS&LR were forced to divest these canals and waterways in 1895.
MS&LR owned the Dearne and Dove Canal, which has a branch that runs to Elsecar.
The rainfall sheets give no details of the gauge location, but the basin at the end of the Elsecar branch is a possible location, and matches the 175 ft elevation given on the early rainfall sheets.
Elsecar Basin has been used for the grid reference given above.
The change of elevation to 181 ft in 1896 corresponds with MS&LR selling the canal, and may indicate a move of the gauge to nearby Elsecar Goods Station.
